title.narrative: Strengthening AJK Through Rural and Urban Resilience (SARUR)

description.narrative:
1) Assessment of community vulnerabilities specific to WASH, disaster preparedness and livelihood. Capacity building of IR Pakistan staff on resilience-building approaches through trainings and exposure. Development of culturally appropriate IEC material on WASH.
2) Development of Disaster Risk management action plan (Rural and Urban). Formation of 50 VDRMCs and WDRMC (Village disaster risk management committees & Ward Disaster risk management committee). Hazard mapping and prioritization of local hazards for the selection of construction of mitigation models. Implementation of structural mitigation models and construction in most hazardous areas. 5 trainings (5 days duration) for VDRMCs/WDRMCS and DMAs officials on CBDRM, HVCA, FA, S&SR. Provision of emergency response equipment to 6 committees. Development of Disaster response and contingency plans consolidated, ready and shared with local authorities.
3) 10 Consultation workshops with Government of AJK specific with SDMA and Planning and Development. Institutional mapping and capacity assessment of SDMA and Public health department. Sensitization and advocating government for DRR sensitive Budget for development activities. Advocacy on the importance of water quality related issues and integrating hygiene promotion and mainstreaming planning of Government concern department.
To build and strengthen urban and rural resilience and capacities to ensure disaster resilience in communities
